7 - 7 ½ million
Thebes and Memphis

ministry of public worship

Failure to properly arrange all of the details and requirements necessary for the King and his retinue considered a “great crime” on the part of the official in charge. Conspiracy to overthrow and kill the King punished by death

Refusal by witnesses to a crime to give evidence punished
Any priests calumniating or intriguing against another loses his office
Wilkinson (1879, Vol. 1: 299) - Maintaining a falsehood under oath considered  the blackest crime against the gods – punished by death. Robbing or defacing a royal tomb severely punished
Fines for non-fulfillment of contract did not go to the insured party, but were taken by the treasury
